parameters: Actor2
Hey, you work for the foreman, right?
People2
Yeah, I do.
Actor2
Do you know where he is? We need to talk to him.
People2
Why do you want to talk to him?
Actor2
It's about the nature spirit.
Actor2
These expansions are destroying the forest
where the nature spirit lives and protects
our city.
Actor2
If we continue destroying the forest like
this, the consequences will be catastrophic.
Actor3
You’re telling me! That mudslide last week just about
took my house out!
People2
Wait… if you convince him then I could
be out of a job.
People2
I need this job to provide for my family.
I understand what you are saying, but
there’s no way I’m letting you talk to him!
I can’t lose this job.
Actor3
From the looks of it, it may be hard to
convince this guy. Halting the expansion of
the city would mean his job is no longer
needed.
Actor3
However, I hear his family lives in a part
of town prone to flooding. That could be
useful information for your argument to
persuade him.
Option 1: Which do you think is more important, a job
or the safety of the entire city including your family?
Option 2: Your job is hurting the nature spirit. I
understand that you need your job to survive, but if we
continue to destroy the forest that the nature spirit
lives in, you won’t have a home to provide for.
Option 1
Option 2
Option 1
People2
My job, of course! If I lose this,
We’ll have nowhere to go.
Actor2
Do you not understand that you will not
have a family to provide for if you
continue to tear down the forest and nature
spirit’s home?
People2
I have survived disasters before. Who’s to say I won’t
survive the ones in the future. I’m sorry, but I will
not bring you to the foreman just for you to get me
fired.
Option 2
People2
What do you mean?
Actor2
The nature spirit protects the city and everyone living
in it from natural disasters. Its home is in the forest
that you have been hired to tear down for the expansion
of the city.
Actor2
By tearing down the forest and the nature spirit’s home,
you are draining its health. The more the spirit’s
health declines, the more natural disasters ensue.
People2
Ok…but what does that have to do with me?
Option 3: I hear that your house is located in a part
of town that is a high flood zone. If the nature
spirit’s health were to decline even more, the next
natural disaster could flood your house leaving you
with no home.
Option 4: You are contributing to the declining health
of the nature spirit. Why would you want to continue to
do something that will hurt the nature spirit and the
city?
Option 3
Option 4
Option 3
People2
Alright.  I see your point now.  I can lead you to the
foreman, but I don’t know if he’ll see eye to eye
with you.
Actor2
I appreciate it.  Either way, we have to try.
Please, lead the way.
Option 4
People2
This isn’t my problem.  I won’t take you
to the foreman. Goodbye.
